incident_updates.body:
### WHAT HAPPENED

Based on reports from our monitoring system, the internal accounts and auth subsystems were not able to give timely responses to certain API calls. Our team identified a lock contention issue within the project information database system.

This incident did NOT affect live environments on Grid or Dedicated infrastructure.

However, SSH, CLI and console features including deployments may have been temporarily unavailable.

‌

### CUSTOMER IMPACT

Between 2024-05-25 02:28 and 03:56 UTC , some customers may have experienced issues while using the SSH / console / CLI / submitting deployments.

This incident did NOT affect live environments on Grid or Dedicated infrastructure.

‌

### WHAT WAS DONE TO RESOLVE THE INCIDENT

Our team have restarted those deadlocked processes to make the accounts and auth subsystems available.

Accounts and Auth subsystems outages are now resolved.

Further investigation on this lock contention issue will be conducted and a fix will be implemented to optimize our subsystems further.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are currently investigating this issue.
This issue does not impact existing live sites / environments.

However, several functions including SSH, console, CLI may not be functioning as expected.

### What Happened:

We detected a partial outage on the EU-4 region, and our investigation identified a host in the region was not operating normally.

### Customer Impact:

A small number of customers may have experienced an outage on any environment that was residing on the abnormal host. This may have included Production environments. 

### Incident Resolution:

Our operations and engineering team isolated the host and manually fixed any environment that did not automatically recover.
All affected project and cluster are successfully recovered.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We have detected an issue affecting service on the EU 4 region. Our Operations team has been notified and is currently working to restore service. 

We will update you as soon as we have further information.

**What Happened:**

On May 11th, at about 14:50 UTC, our upstream provider, experienced an internal incident that affected the availability of their Virtual Machines \(VMs\) and Object Storage Devices \(OSDs\).

**Customer Impact:**

This incident affected all container types \(production, staging, development\) in the FR-1 region, impacting multiple projects. Affected projects experienced container outages, including production containers in some cases.

**Incident Resolution:**

During the incident, our engineers actively communicated with the upstream provider to ensure a swift resolution.

On May 12th, at about 20:30 UTC, following the underlying provider full recovery, our engineers ensured all production environments were fully operational.

On May 13th, at about 07:00 UTC, our engineers conducted a comprehensive review of all affected components to confirm their full functionality and address any outstanding technical issues.
This incident has been resolved.

All services are currently operational. Our engineering team is conducting a comprehensive review of all affected components to confirm their full functionality and address any outstanding technical issues.
All affected projects data and environments have been recovered successfully. Some metrics services may still be unavailable.
Our upstream provider has recovered impacted hosts. We are monitoring the results.

Most impacted hosts and projects have been fully recovered. 

The upstream provider is still working on full recovery.

Our hosts have been recovered and all projects are operational.
The upstream provider is still working on full recovery of their data centre.
The upstream provider has recovered our core hosts and the projects are back online.
We are continuing to work with our upstream provider on recovery.
We are continuing to work with our upstream provider on recovery.
Our upstream provider has encountered an unexpected temperature increase which required the emergency shutdown of the servers impacted by this incident. They are actively working on recovery.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The issue has been identified and we are working on recovering the affected hosts.

We have detected an issue affecting service on the FR-1 region. Our Operations team has been notified and is currently working to restore service. Projects on affected regions may experience slowness and unresponsive sites.
We will update you as soon as we have further information.

**What Happened**

We detected a substantial drop in connections reaching the CA-1 region from "14:29 UTC" to "15:39 UTC" on May 11th, 2024.

**Customer Impact**

Customers experienced intermittent availability during this time as connections were dropped, and requests failed to reach the CA-1 origin.

**Incident Resolution**

We suspect a transient network failure with our upstream provider, or another network layer upstream, was responsible for this incident.
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We have detected an issue affecting service on the CA-1 region. Our Operations team has been notified and is currently working to restore service. Projects on affected regions may experience unresponsive site.
We will update you as soon as we have further information.

incidents.name: Downtime for some sites on the CA-1 region

incident_updates.body:
**What Happened**: The incident was triggered when the incoming request gateway on cluster CA-1 depleted its resources, caused by an unforeseen surge in usage. This led to the gateway being unable to process incoming traffic effectively.

**Customer Impact**: Approximately 50 projects were affected during a 30-minute period, experiencing intermittent downtime ranging from 5 to 10 minutes. This disruption impacted the operational functionality of these projects, leading to degraded service availability.

**Incident Resolution**: To address this issue, we have permanently increased the resource capacity of the incoming request gateway to better handle similar spikes in traffic in the future. Additionally, we have identified the source of the unexpected usage and are implementing measures to prevent a recurrence of this problem.
All services are fully operational. No further downtime was registered in the past 2 hours.

During our first investigation round, we have identified that the downtime could have been related to resource constraints on our incoming gateway. We have permanently increased the gateway capacity to prevent similar issues in the future.

We have detected an issue intermittently impacting approximately 50 production environments between 07:15 and 07:45 AM UTC. The affected environments experienced downtime ranging from 5 to 10 minutes.

We are actively investigating issue.

**WHAT HAPPENED**

Users were unable to interact with projects through web console and CLI due to issues with the authentication backend.

This incident did not affect live environments on Grid or Dedicated infrastructure.

After investigation, our engineers identified errors in logs which lead to following remedial actions:

* Backend was restarted

* Underlying hosts were replaced

* Additional capacity was added

**CUSTOMER IMPACT**

Between 2024-05-01 01:48 UTC and 03:21 UTC, customers were unable to access console or use CLI 

There was no impact on environments or production sites.

**WHAT WAS DONE TO RESOLVE THE INCIDENT**

The authentication backend was restarted and additional capacity was added.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue as reoccured and our team is investigating
We identified an issue with our Auth system. Our team has performed some work to restore service availability and we're monitoring the situation
We are investigating a report of outages on our API and CLI

**WHAT HAPPENED**

Environments were in unexpected states during the planned maintenance event for region [eu-2.platform.sh](http://eu-2.platform.sh)  
[https://status.platform.sh/incidents/97ls23652mws](https://status.platform.sh/incidents/97ls23652mws)

Affected environments including live sites were not available for use during the incident,  
this also includes functionalities like SSH accesses / deployments.

‌

Dedicated clusters were **NOT** affected by this incident.

‌

**CUSTOMER IMPACT**

Some customers' environments were not available for up to 9 hrs and 12 minutes in total.  
\(Worst case estimate for all live & non-live environments\)

Start: 2024-04-24 21:50 **UTC**  
End:   2024-04-25 07:02 **UTC**

‌

**WHAT WAS DONE TO RESOLVE THE INCIDENT**

The unexpected states had been corrected by our engineers and now the environments should function as expected.  
Our engineering team will also be investigating a potential internal bug responsible for those unexpected states causing this incident.

We will be improving the internal subsystems in order to minimize the negative impact from these planned maintenance events in the future.

Our engineers have deployed a fix to correct the issues.

All environments in this region should now function as expected.
All live / default environments should now function as expected.

We have detected an issue affecting service on the eu-2.platform.sh region.

Our Operations team has been notified and is currently working to restore service.
Projects on affected regions may experience outages.

We will update you as soon as we have further information.

**What Happened**

On March 29, 2024, at 07:23 UTC, a large increase in incoming connections to the [uk-1.platform.sh](http://uk-1.platform.sh) region caused the gateways to become unresponsive. Availability of sites/environments in the region was impacted.  
This incident did not affect Dedicated clusters.

**Customer Impact**

Grid projects on the [uk-1.platform.sh](http://uk-1.platform.sh) region were affected, resulting in temporary outages and reduced performance for customer sites. Sites availability and performance was shortly degraded.

**What Was Done to Resolve the Incident**

To address the issue, our engineers initially blocked the majority of the malicious \(DDoS\) traffic at the time and made various configuration and software changes in our internal gateway systems to handle these situations better.  
They continued monitoring the changes to ensure system stability and performance.
This incident has been resolved.

A large increase in incoming connections to the uk-1.platform.sh region caused the gateways to become unresponsive.

Traffic has been blocked and we're seeing gateway performance returning to normal. We're continuing to monitor the situation and will take additional action if needed.

## What happened

Upstream provider had planned network maintenance causing unexpected interruption to our services in region `fr-3.platform.sh`

‌

## Customer Impact

All environments in region `fr-3.platform.sh` were unreachable temporarily, some of those environments may have experienced outages for more than 1.5 hours.

‌

## What was done to resolve the incident

Based on the internal monitoring alerts, our team migrated all the affected environments to the healthy hosts.  
And our upstream provider had also resolved the network issues so that our infrastructure can then function as expected.
This incident has been resolved.

Our upstream provider is still working on their planned network maintenance events.
Given the unexpected interruption to our services, we would like to monitor this region for prolonged period of time.

All environments should now function as expected.
Please submit a support ticket if you need further assistance from our team.
Our team has successfully migrated affected environments to working hosts and will monitor the situation with our upstream provider
Our team is still actively working on migrating the environments away from the affected hosts.

There is a technical issue stemming from our upstream provider.
They are actively investigating and recovering the availability of the service.

We will update you as soon as we have further information.

## **What happened**

A surge in incoming connections to the uk-1.platform.sh region rendered the gateways unresponsive, affecting the availability of sites and environments within the region.

This incident did not affect Dedicated clusters.

## **Customer Impact**

During the incident, which commenced at 07:23 UTC on 2024-03-29, certain sites in the uk-1.platform.sh region experienced unavailability.

Sites were restored within 10 minutes, with normal operations resuming by 07:33 UTC.

## **What was done to resolve the incident**

## **Short term mitigations**

Our engineering team is actively analyzing the attack patterns to fortify the resilience of our incoming request gateways, including reviewing rate limit configurations and adding further gateway capacity.
This incident has been resolved.

A large increase in incoming connections to the uk-1.platform.sh region caused the gateways to become unresponsive.

Traffic has been blocked and we're seeing gateway performance returning to normal. We're continuing to monitor the situation and will take additional action if needed.

This incident did not affect Dedicated clusters.

##   
Customer impact

Some sites in `us-4.platform.sh` region were unavailable during the incident \(starting at 04:23 **UTC** on 2024-03-27\).  
Most affected sites have recovered within 18 minutes \(by 04:41 **UTC**\).

##   
What was done to resolve the incident

We have blocked some malicious \(DDOS\) traffic to the region.
Alerts for the region have cleared following filtering of the excess traffic, and the region is again stable.
Traffic has been blocked and we're seeing gateway performance returning to normal. We're continuing to monitor the situation and will take additional action if needed.

Our Operations team has been notified and is currently investigating the issue.

## **What happened**

A large increase in incoming connections to the uk-1.platform.sh region caused the gateways to become unresponsive. Availability of sites/environments in the region was impacted.

This incident did not affect Dedicated clusters.

## **Customer Impact**

incidents.name: Intermittent issues with Console, API and CLI

incident_updates.body:
**Incident Summary**

Our backend API response became unstable, rendering the Console and CLI unavailable for users. This instability disrupted services and impacted user experience.

**What Happened**

Our backend API experienced a combination of performance issues, including API gateway instability, Fastly performance degradation, increased incoming requests, and backend performance issues. These factors culminated in the disruption of API services, leading to the unavailability of the Console and CLI for users.

**Customer Impact**

The incident resulted in service disruptions for our users, preventing them from accessing critical functionalities through the Console and CLI.

**Incident Resolution Steps**

To address the incident and restore stability to the API, the following steps were taken:

1. **Temporary Mitigation:** We promptly evacuated the API gateways from the miss behaving hosts as a temporary measure to mitigate the instability and restore basic functionality to the API.
2. **Monitoring and Analysis:** Following the mitigation, we closely monitored the API performance to ensure stability and analyzed the impact of the incident on user experience.
3. **Root Cause Analysis:** Subsequent to stabilizing the API, we conducted a comprehensive root cause analysis to identify the underlying factors contributing to the incident, including API gateway performance issues, Fastly performance degradation, increased incoming requests, and backend performance issues.
4. **Long-Term Remediation:** Based on the root cause analysis, we documented long-term remediation, to improve overall system resilience and reliability.

**Identified Root Cause and Impacts**

The root cause of the incident is multifaceted, involving various components of our infrastructure:

* API gateway performance issues
* Fastly performance degradation
* Increased incoming requests
* Backend performance issues

These factors combined to create instability within the API, resulting in service disruptions and user inconvenience.
This incident has been resolved.

The underlying API performance is back within the expected threshold. The affected components are working as expected.
We are monitoring the availability of the API to ensure the performance stays within the expected thresholds.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We have detected an issue affecting the intermittent access to Console UI, API, and CLI on the UK 1 region.

Live sites are not impacted. We are actively working to restore service.

**WHAT HAPPENED**

Our API cluster was overwhelmed by database connections which made it unresponsive.

**CUSTOMER IMPACT**

Console UI, API, and CLI were not available between 11:22 and 12:46 UTC.

**WHAT WAS DONE TO RESOLVE THE INCIDENT**

The API cluster has been restarted.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We have detected an issue affecting Console UI, API, and CLI.

Live sites are not impacted. Token-based authentication is functional. We are actively working to restore service.

incidents.name: FR-3: Backup can fail, leading to unusable environment

incident_updates.body:
**What happened**

Our internal software had a dependency issue with blob storage controller libraries used to access the underlying blob storage.

**Customer impact**

In some cases, it lead to container startup failure.

**Incident resolution**

Our engineers released a fix on the region.
This incident has been resolved.
The fix has now been deployed. Affected projects are now working as expected.

We are currently deploying a new version of our internal software that should address this issue.
The deployment is expected to take at least an hour.

We have identified an issue that can cause backups to fail for some projects. Affected projects will be unable to use the backup feature at all. Backup failure can lead to container failure, cascading to application level failure due to container unavailability.
We recommend avoiding using the backup, and sync feature at this moment.

**WHAT HAPPENED**

Here is the list of affected regions:

```
au.platform.sh
au-2.platform.sh
ca-1.platform.sh
uk-1.platform.sh
us.platform.sh
us-2.platform.sh
```

Above affected regions received recent internal upgrades having environments not functioning as expected for data synchronization activities.  
This also includes new environments creation requiring cloning parent environment's data.

‌

**CUSTOMER IMPACT**

Customers' environments were affected for up to 24 hours and 29 minutes in total.  
From 2024-01-31 06:21 **UTC** to 2024-02-01 06:50 **UTC**  
\(based on earliest timestamp of region received the upgrade\).

‌

Existing environments including live sites should NOT be affected.

‌

**WHAT WAS DONE TO RESOLVE THE INCIDENT**

After extensive investigation, our engineering team implemented an emergency fix and deployed it to all the affected regions to correct that unexpected behavior.  
The data synchronization should now function as expected.
This incident has been resolved.

Our engineering team had just deployed the fix to the affected regions.
We are still monitoring the regions.
Our engineers had implemented the fix and now we are finalizing necessary process for testing and verification phase before releasing the fix to the affected regions.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We are seeing issues with syncing data between environments in multiple regions.  Our operations team is investigating.  Affected projects will not be able to synchronize data, and new environments will not contain data from their parent environment.

There is no impact to the availability of production sites.

WHAT HAPPENED

A surge in traffic on the EU-2 region briefly caused availability issues for some sites in the region.


CUSTOMER IMPACT

Around 16:30 UTC, some sites may have experienced intermittent connection problems for approximately 10 minutes.


WHAT WAS DONE TO RESOLVE THE INCIDENT

We're continuing to investigate the source of the traffic and take proactive measures to block the source.

**What happened**

The succession of two unexpected events, a host reboot at 14:16 UTC, and a traffic spike at 14:30 UTC, caused performance issues on the host.

**Customer impact**

A limited amount of sites experienced a 30 minutes outage.

**Incident resolution**

Our engineers recovered the stability of the host following those two unexpected events.
This incident has been resolved.

Our engineers recovered the affected gateway to normal operation and are now monitoring its stability.
All affected sites should now work as expected.

We have identified a significantly increased amount of incoming requests within a short amount of time, but the sites/environments should now function as expected.

Our team is still actively checking for other possible causes and monitoring our internal gateways and their responsiveness.

We have detected an issue affecting service on the de-2.platform.sh region. Our Operations team has been notified and is currently working to restore service. Projects on affected region may experience site outages.

We will update you as soon as we have further information.

## **What happened**

Gateways in region de-2.platform.sh were not responsive, availability of those sites / environments was negatively impacted.

This incident did not affect Dedicated clusters.

‌

While there was a huge spike of connection attempts during this incident, after our further review, we also found out that there were transient network interruptions stemming from the upstream provider.

‌

Incident had been resolved shortly after our internal review.

‌

## **Customer Impact**

Some environments / sites in region de-2.platform.sh were not available for around 7 minutes \( from 02:32 to 02:39 UTC on 2023-12-30 \)

‌

## **What was done to resolve the incident**

We concluded those transient network interruptions stemming from the upstream provider were part of the failover event.
This incident has been resolved.
All negatively impacted sites / environments are now functioning as expected.

We have identified an abnormal pattern of huge amount of incoming requests within a short amount of time but the sites / environments should now function as expected.

However, our team is still actively monitoring our internal gateways and their responsiveness.

We have detected an issue affecting service on the de-2.platform.sh region. Our Operations team has been notified and is currently working to restore service. Projects on affected region may experience site outages.

We will update you as soon as we have further information.

incidents.name: Build fails with error: Could not authenticate against github.com

incident_updates.body:
**What happened**  
The token from our build system, used to download packages from [GitHub.com](http://GitHub.com), was unexpectedly revoked.

**Customer Impact**  
Some builds failed with the error:  Could not authenticate against [github.com](http://github.com).

**Resolution**  
Our engineers deployed a fix to our build systems.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been deployed. Builds should now be working as expected.

We have identified an issue which can cause some builds to fail with the following error: `Could not authenticate against github.com`. Our engineers are currently working to resolve this issue.

As a workaround, you can authenticate with those steps:
* Create a new GitHub token at https://github.com/settings/tokens
* Generate a new token (classic)
* Give it this permission: public_repo
* Update your project environments variables via the CLI with
```
variable:create --level project --name env:COMPOSER_AUTH --json true --visible-runtime false --sensitive true --visible-build true --value '{"http-basic": {"github.com": {"username": "YOUR_GITHUB_USERNAME", "password": "ghp_YOUR_TOKEN"}}}'
```
* Trigger a new build

incidents.name: FR-1: CLI, Console UI, and deployments unavailable

incident_updates.body:
### What happened

Coordinators on the FR-1 region were failing to connect with our Platform API server.

### Customer Impact

The CLI, console UI, and API on FR-1 were returning 502s, and inaccessible during the outage, which lasted from 15:20 UTC to 20:51 UTC today.

### What was done to resolve the incident

A configuration change was implemented to resolve the connection issues, and restore service to the API on FR-1.

We are working with the associated cloud provider to determine what originally brought about the issue.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
This is still being actively investigated.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

CLI, Console UI, and deployments are currently unavailable on the fr-1.platform.sh region. 

Live sites serving traffic are not impacted.

Our engineers are aware of the issue and working on the solution.

**WHAT HAPPENED**

One of the regional gateways stopped responding to some of the requests.

**CUSTOMER IMPACT**

Between 2023-12-02 08:23 and 10:15 UTC, some of the sites hosted in this region experienced intermittent short timeouts.

**WHAT WAS DONE TO RESOLVE THE INCIDENT**

We have taken the affected gateway out of rotation and are continuing with the investigation.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We are currently investigating a possible issue affecting the eu-4 region. 
We will update you as soon as we have further information.

**What happened**  
A maintenance triggered an unintended change on developments hosts on the [fr-1.platform.sh](http://fr-1.platform.sh) region. This change cause application and service container to crash unexpectedly in some cases.

**Customer Impact**  
Some services and application containers on development and staging environments experienced unexpected crashes, usually causing the application to fail on such an event. Production hosts were unaffected by this incident.

**Resolution steps**  
The unintended change was reverted on all affected development hosts.
This incident has been resolved.
The hosts have been recovered and are now operating as expected.
The issue only affects staging, and development environments. It does not affect production environments. Those environments might experience downtime while our engineers apply the necessary changes.

We have identified an issue on the fr-1.platform.sh region that can cause some services and app containers to unexpectedly fail. We have found the root cause and are now working toward fixing the issue.

incidents.name: FR-3: CLI, Console UI, and deployments unavailable

incident_updates.body:
**What happened**  
An issue with our service manager prevented disks from being used properly, causing the CLI, Console \(UI\), and deployments to fail for projects on the affected hosts.

**Customer Impact**  
This issue affected about 300 projects starting at 9:45. Recovery started at 10.41, and the last host was recovered at 11:29 UTC.

**Resolution steps**  
Services were manually recovered. Our engineers are currently deploying the related software bug fixes.
This incident has been resolved.
Service are fully recovered. We are now monitoring the stability.
Our engineers are still working on recovering services. Some affected projects will work as expected, while others will still experience issues.
CLI, Console UI, and deployments are currently unavailable on the fr-3.platform.sh region. Our engineers are aware of the issue and working on the solution.

We experienced a brief, partial outage of the UK-1 region.  While we were investigating and preparing public updates, the outage was resolved by our operations team.

WHAT HAPPENED

A gateway in the UK-1 region experienced an internal issue that required a restart.  We utilize 3 gateways in the region, and the other two were healthy and serving traffic during this time.  However, requests that were attempting to utilize the gateway with issues would have failed.

CUSTOMER IMPACT

Some requests to sites in the UK-1 region would have experienced intermittent outages for approximately 10-15 minutes.

WHAT WAS DONE TO RESOLVE THE INCIDENT

The gateway was restarted to clear the immediate issue, and our engineering team will follow up to find a root cause.

**What happened**

A short DDoS attack on one of the sites in the us-2 region caused overload of the regional gateways. As attack subsided, the load returned to normal.

**Customer impact**

Sites displaying TLS connection failures between 2023-11-27 08:41 and 08:52 UTC. The outage only affected sites hosted on grid infrastructure.
Services have been fully operational for the past 45 minutes, and are working as expected.
We have detected an issue affecting service on the us-2 region. Our operations team has quickly restored service. Projects on this region may have experienced TLS certificate issues.

**WHAT HAPPENED**

A short DDoS attack on one of the sites in the us-2 region caused overload of the regional gateways.

As attack subsided, the load returned back to normal.

**CUSTOMER IMPACT**

Sites displaying TLS connection failures between 2023-11-26 08:41 and 08:59 UTC.

The outage only affected sites hosted on grid infrastructure.

**WHAT WAS DONE TO RESOLVE THE INCIDENT**

Outage self-resolved.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We have detected an issue affecting service on the us-2 region. Our Operations team is currently working to restore service. Projects on this region may experience TLS certificate issues.
We will update you as soon as we have further information.

## **What happened**

A host in the region became overloaded, and caused degraded performance on sites running on that node.  

## **Customer Impact**

Sites running on the affected node would have seen performance issues or timeouts from approximately 14:20 UTC to 16:10 UTC.  Some sites experienced a number of brief outages during those times.

## **What was done to resolve the incident**

An additional host was added to the region, and some projects on the overloaded host were migrated to the new host.  This balanced the load issues and resolved the performance problems we saw.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We have detected an issue affecting service on the FR-4 regions. Our Operations team has been notified and is currently working to restore service. Projects in affected regions may experience timeouts or performance issues on their site.

We will update you as soon as we have further information.

incidents.name: CLI, API, Console UI and SSH access experiencing degraded performance on DE 2

incident_updates.body:
### What happened

An API-endpoint coordinator ended up in a degraded state after an upgrade was performed on the region.

### Customer impact

API, CLI, Console, and SSH access were degraded for projects on the DE-2 region for roughly two hours. During this time, requests to the project API would intermittently respond with 502s. Traffic to live sites was not impacted throughout the incident duration.

### What was done to resolve the incident

The degraded API-endpoint coordinator was recovered.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We have detected degraded performance impacting CLI, Console UI, and SSH access on DE-2 projects. We are actively investigating, and working to restore service.

Please note that traffic to live sites is not impacted. Production sites are fully online and serving requests.

We will update you as soon as we have further information.

**What happened**

We added object storage devices to the [de-2.platform.sh](http://de-2.platform.sh) region. This change unexpectedly caused I/O performance issues.

**Customer impact**

Affected environments experienced slower than usual read and write operations, or their writable mounts suddenly became read-only.

**Resolution steps**

The response team added more object storage, allowing the data recalibration to complete faster, and to provide more I/O throughput to affected projects. Read-only mounts were manually investigated and recovered.
Services have been fully operational for the last 3 hours. This incident is resolved.
We have fully recovered the availability of all services. All affected environments should now be working as expected. We're monitoring the situation closely.
Data reallocation is still ongoing, affecting some environments. Affected environments can experience reduce input/output performance.

We are continuing to monitor the data reallocation process. Changes have been implemented to reduce the performance impact of the ongoing procedures, but the region will continue experiencing degraded performance until this is complete. We currently estimate that the ongoing process may still take a number of hours to complete fully.
Routine Ceph OSDs being added into the region is currently resulting in an elevated level of Input/Output (IO) and now throttling above normal levels.

We have detected an issue affecting service on the de-2.platform.sh region. Our Operations team has been notified and is currently working to restore service. Projects on affected regions may experience degraded performance.
We will update you as soon as we have further information.

## **What happened**

An issue during an upgrade to our API caused parts of it to go partially offline.  The containers and services on one node of the cluster were not accessible, and caused intermittent issues on some requests to some parts of the API.

## **Customer Impact**

The Console and UI were intermittently offline for approximately 3 hours.  There was no impact on production site availability.

## **What was done to resolve the incident**

The issue was limited to one node of the cluster, and that node was disabled to fix the immediate customer-facing issues.  The underlying issue was resolved, and the node returned to service.
This incident has been resolved.
Our Teams will continue to closely monitor Organizations API cluster, our next update will follow in 24 hours.
Our team has restored service to all nodes in the cluster. We are monitoring the Organizations API cluster and the console.

The Engineering Team have shifted the traffic to the working nodes in the cluster and are troubleshooting the issue.

We are monitoring the Organizations API cluster and the console.
We are seeing failures on the Organizations API cluster and our Engineering team is working to correct the problem.
Our Team have restored service to the Organizations API cluster and the console is now responding. We are monitoring the Organizations API cluster and the console.
Our Teams are still working on this issue. We have engaged our Engineering Team to assist with the troubleshooting process.

Our Operations Team have performed and upgrade on our Organizations API cluster and have encountered an issue. 

At this time, the console and the API are not responding correctly to all calls.

We are working with the team to bring this endpoint back online.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Dedicated Enterprise routes issue on deployment

incident_updates.body:
### What happened

An update to our API introduced a bug that caused the routes configuration to break when a deployment was performed.

### Customer Impact

The impact was limited to a small number of projects due to the issue only occurring after a deployment which then caused projects to return a 404 or 50X error response. Affected project owners have been notified via support tickets advising the corrective actions taken by our team.

### What was done to resolve the incident

We manually fixed affected projects while working on a global fix. Once the fix was ready and verified, we rolled it out to the affected projects.
This incident has been resolved.

We have rolled out a fix and we are actively monitoring the situation. All impacted projects have undergone necessary corrections. Should any persisting issues arise, we kindly request that you provide an update through the designated ticket we have created.

We have identified the issue as a result of a recent update to our API (24:35). 

We have identified all potentially impacted customers and have opened support tickets for each project that did receive this update. So far we have only received reports from two customers related to this issue. We opened an incident promptly to avoid any further impact.

If you have not received a ticket notifying you of the issue you are safe to proceed as normal.

If you have any further questions do not hesitate to open a support ticket.

At this time there are no updates to provide.

Our teams are continuing the investigation.

We are continuing our investigation into today’s broken routes for dedicated environments.

At this time we have only received a minimum number of site down notifications. Our HighSLA monitoring will continue to monitor for uptime and we will proceed to reach out if your environment is impacted.

We are working to identify only the impacted dedicated clusters and will communicate once we have finished this analysis.

At this time, please refrain from deployments to your dedicated production environments as a precautionary measure.

We have detected an issue affecting our Dedicated Enterprise clusters.

This will cause your environment's routes to be incorrectly generated.  Please do not deploy any Dedicated Enterprise clusters.

Our Operations and Engineering Teams are working to identify and correct the issue as soon as possible.

incidents.name: Partial Outage on Orange service provider

incident_updates.body:
**What happened**

An intermittent and unidentified issue caused some customers hosted on Orange infrastructure to experience their websites and/or UI to become unavailable. The issue self resolved during investigation.

**How long customers were impacted**

From 09:06 UTC to 09:46 UTC, 40 minutes in total.

**How many customers were impacted**

The issue affected the availability of some environments and/or UI for some projects.

**What was done to resolve the incident**

The event resolved itself automatically. We have contacted the provider in order to fully investigate this event.
This incident has been resolved.
All production environments are recovered and available as expected again. We are monitoring the availability.

We have detected an issue affecting service on the production environments availability for sites hosted on Orange service provider. Our Operations team has been notified and is currently working to restore service. Projects on affected regions may experience downtime.

We will update you as soon as we have further information.

incidents.name: Console, API and Auth outage on Ibexa cloud

incident_updates.body:
# What happened

A recent failed deployment to the Ibexa admin project led to containers being unable to open.  
This is directly responsible for the console, API and Auth sub-systems outage on Ibexa cloud.  
  
This incident did not affect live environments on Grid or Dedicated infrastructure.  
  
After our further review, our engineers have also identified that a known bug within the deployment service was responsible for the above failure.  
A fix has been implemented earlier and we are working on scheduling the release of the fix globally.

# How long customers were impacted

From 2023-11-08 06:10 UTC to 06:47 UTC, 37 minutes in total.

# How many customers were impacted

All Ibexa customers were unable to access console or conduct any deployments during the impact period.

# What was done to resolve the incident

Our team quickly re-opened / restarted the affected containers and made them available again.  
Console, API and Auth sub-systems outage on Ibexa cloud are now resolved.

We have detected an issue affecting Console, API and Auth systems on Ibexa cloud after a recent failed deployment since 2023-11-08 21:10 UTC.

This outage does not affect Dedicated Enterprise Clusters nor your environments.

Our Operations team has been notified and corrected the issue by restarting the services since 2023-11-08 21:47 UTC.

A fix for this known issue has been implemented, and this will be released in the future.

**What happened**

The service handling incoming requests, on one of the [de-2.platform.sh](http://de-2.platform.sh) regional gateway, stopped processing requests. The response team switched the faulty gateway, with a freshly provisioned one. Shortly after, the faulty gateway was fully recovered.

**How long customers were impacted**

Some projects were affected for up to 45 minutes, however most recovered within 20 minutes.

**How many customers were impacted**

The issue affected the availability of all environments for some projects.

**Resolution steps**

During the incident, a temporary gateway was added, until the faulty gateway was fully recovered.  
Our engineers are currently investigating the root cause of the service failure.
This incident has been resolved.
We fully recovered the affected gateway. Incoming traffic is handled as expected. All effected projects are now fully available, and working as expected.
One of the regional gateway is currently not processing incoming requests. Therefore, affected projects environments are not receiving incoming requests.

We have detected an issue affecting service on the de-2.platform.sh region. Our Operations team has been notified and is currently working to restore service. Projects on affected regions may experience downtime.
We will update you as soon as we have further information.

# WHAT HAPPENED

On November 1, 2023, at 14:46 UTC, the system which holds our user data started intermittently exhibiting slower than normal response times. As our teams began investigating, the problem disappeared approximately ten minutes later \(14:56\) and then reappeared from 15:00 to 15:29. At that point, the system returned to normal operation. Believing the problem to be a transient occurrence, no status page notice was created at that time. The system continued to behave normally until the following day at approximately 13:05 UTC, when the problem reappeared, and we provided the first notice on the status page at 14:05. After further investigation, we determined that the underlying cause was that a data import job that had previously executed in serial fashion had been changed to execute in parallel, and that led to a higher than anticipated load on our accounts system.

# HOW LONG CUSTOMERS WERE IMPACTED

From November 1, 2023 14:46 UTC to 14:56 \(10 minutes\), November 1, 2023 15:00 to 15:29 \(29 minutes\), and November 2 from 13:05 to 16:25 \(3 hours, 20 minutes\), for a total of 3 hours, 59 minutes across all occurrences.

# HOW MANY CUSTOMERS WERE IMPACTED

All projects were subject to the impact. Customer environment availability was not affected by this incident, however access to the user interface, Platform CLI, and API was intermittently unavailable during the times listed above. 

# WHAT WAS DONE TO RESOLVE THE INCIDENT

The data import job was rolled back to the previous, serial version, and the underlying servers were also doubled in size. We are also revamping our incident handling procedures to ensure that more timely notifications of incidents will happen in the future.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Some users can experience degraded performance or intermittent unavailability with UI (Console) and CLI.
Environments availability is NOT impacted.

### WHAT HAPPENED

On October 28th at 0725 our internal monitoring notified of a storage alert in the uk-1.platform.sh region. Reviewing the storage usage across all storage hosts in the region, the decision was made to rebalance the storage across the existing hosts without adding more. The alert resolved shortly afterward.

On October 31st at 0445 UTC the same alert reappeared and our operations team added 3 additional storage hosts to the region. Adding new storage hosts to an existing region requires rebalancing of the data to ensure effective data replication.

During investigation it was found that several storage hosts in the region were exhibiting extremely high read activity \(burst\), leading to the read/write operations in the region being throttled. This is a limitation of the instance types being used for storage hosts on this provider. These bursts, in addition to the increased read/write activity from the rebalancing operations in the region resulted in slower than normal storage read/write rates to customer projects.

At 1800 UTC, another three additional storage hosts were added to the region to speed up the rebalance process and reduce the read/write load on the individual hosts. This immediately resolved the throttling and service returned to normal.

### HOW MANY CUSTOMERS WERE IMPACTED

All projects on the UK-1 region were impacted by this incident across all environments for a period of up to 14 hours. Impact ranged from periods of downtime to slow performance. There was no data lost as a result of this incident.

### WHAT WAS DONE TO RESOLVE THE INCIDENT

The addition of a further three storage hosts to the region allowed the read/write rates to return to normal levels as the system was able to balance them across more hosts. While we work to optimize the storage daemon to prevent this from reoccuring we have also changed the instance and storage types to a combination with higher read/write rates. Furthermore, we have updated our internal procedures around when to add additional storage hosts to regions to prevent overloading on regions on this infrastructure provider.
This incident has been resolved.
The data reallocation process has completed and we are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
